title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

General Considerations:

For Task A1, the response must correctly describe one restriction to civil society adopted after Vladimir Putin became president in 2000.

For Task A2, the response must correctly describe a second restriction to civil society adopted after Vladimir Putin became president in 2000.

For Tasks B, the response must correctly explain why the Russian government restricts civil society.

For Task C, the response must correctly describe an example of a political activity that indicates civil society has persisted despite these restrictions.

For Task D, the response must correctly explain why the Russian government continues to allow some civil society groups.

Points for each Task are earned independently of each other.
descriptions: The response accomplishes none of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes one of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes two of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes three of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes four of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes five of the tasks set by the question.
